description: A large nylon pouch that can hold a 1-quart canteen, like those issued to the U.S. soldiers.  Can serve as an impromptu dump pouch.

description: A tall nylon pouch for storing water bottles.  Takes in tall bottles up to 1.5L in capacity.

description: A skeletonized nylon pouch made with two orthogonal straps supported by elastic bands and a generous amount of threading.  Intended to hold a full-sized two-way radio for military communications, it can hold a single smaller item in its stead.

description: A nylon pouch with two compartments.  The smaller front compartment is designed to hold smaller smartphones or other digital devices.  The larger back compartment can hold something larger, like a small power bank.  The latter also has two thin pouches for things like plastic cards.

half the volume of the pouch, minus another 5 ml to allow slightly-smaller items

//notes: small straps on the side of pouches are not currently modelled

has an interior separator inside the main pocket, which it didn't seem wise to model, since there's no way to separate volume of main pocket from volume of separator 'pocket' without breaking something about pocket management for the player
unlike many other pouches, this one can be worn directly over the shoulder
description: A small nylon bag.  Can be worn over the shoulder or strapped to webbing.  Has plenty of pockets.

variants.description: A small nylon bag that has both MOLLE straps and a shoulder strap.  It can be worn over the shoulder or attached to a PALS webbing.  Best used on an expedition where you may not need a lot of ammo, but would require food, drink, medication, or other short-term supplies.  <variant_multicam>

A small nylon bag that has both MOLLE straps and a shoulder strap.  It can be worn over the shoulder or attached to a PALS webbing.  Best used on an expedition where you may not need a lot of ammo, but would require food, drink, medication, or other short-term supplies.  <variant_black>

A small nylon bag that has both MOLLE straps and a shoulder strap.  It can be worn over the shoulder or attached to a PALS webbing.  Best used on an expedition where you may not need a lot of ammo, but would require food, drink, medication, or other short-term supplies.  <variant_coyote>

A small nylon bag that has both MOLLE straps and a shoulder strap.  It can be worn over the shoulder or attached to a PALS webbing.  Best used on an expedition where you may not need a lot of ammo, but would require food, drink, medication, or other short-term supplies.  This one is red with black accents.

description: A nylon pouch with straps to hold onto either leg.  Can also be strapped to webbing. Provides extra storage.

description: A compact pouch for storing small tools.  Can be attached to webbing and carried on your backpack or load-bearing vest.

variants.description: A compact, low-profile MOLLE pouch for storing small tools and miscellanea.  Features half-a-dozen different pockets, including one on the outside that's the perfect fit for a smartphone, and even more straps on the inside.  <variant_multicam>

A compact, low-profile MOLLE pouch for storing small tools and miscellanea.  Features half-a-dozen different pockets, including one on the outside that's the perfect fit for a smartphone, and even more straps on the inside.  <variant_coyote>

//weight: the item's listing offers several different statements on its weight
we err on the side of US-centric measurements, since those hadn't been (aggressively) adjusted to look nice

pocket_data.//max_contains_volume: volume of an iPhone 11 Pro (as mentioned in the listing), +10% since the smartphone didn't occupy the entire pocket

//max_contains_volume: dimensions calculated as
90% of height = 6.12 in.
0.7 in., taken from Leatherman Wave+
https://www.leatherman.com/wave-10.html
trim is 50%, to account for the pocket not being able to stretch to 0.7 in. across the entire pocket
dimensions calculated as
90% of height = 6.12 in.
0.7 in., taken from Leatherman Wave+
https://www.leatherman.com/wave-10.html
trim is 50%, to account for the pocket not being able to stretch to 0.7 in. across the entire pocket
dimensions calculated as
95% of height = 6.46 in.
95% of width = 8.36 in.
0.3 in., the thickness of an iPad
trim is 12.5%, to account for the pocket not being able to stretch to 0.7 in. across the entire pocket
dimensions calculated as
87.5% of height = 5.95 in.
95% of width = 8.36 in.
0.2 in., slightly smaller than the full-width pocket
trim is 12.5%, to account for the pocket not being able to stretch to 0.7 in. across the entire pocket
by width and thickness, it appears to fit exactly the Leatherman Skeletool CX
https://www.leatherman.com/skeletool-cx-19.html
we use 80% of the pouch's height (= 7.04 in.) for length, in order to emulate enabling easy access to the pouches behind the straps
pocket_data.//min_item_length: half of height of the pocket = 3.52 in.

//max_contains_volume: we take the average of width between the small and the large back straps: (2.72 + 1.24) / 2 = 1.98 in.
we use 0.52 in. as the thickness, to keep to parity with the other types of back straps
we use 80% of the pouch's height (= 7.04 in.) for length, in order to emulate enabling easy access to the pouches behind the straps
pocket_data.//min_item_length: half of height of the pocket = 3.52 in.

//max_contains_volume: by width and thickness, it appears to fit the Otterbox power bank well
https://www.otterbox.co.uk/en-gb/portable-power-bank%C2%A0-usb-a-and-usb-c-grey/78-80641.html
we add 0.1 in to the thickness in order to bring it to parity with the small back strap
we use 80% of the pouch's height (= 7.04 in.) for length, in order to emulate enabling easy access to the pouches behind the straps
pocket_data.//min_item_length: half of height of the pocket = 3.52 in.

//max_contains_volume: by width and thickness, it appears to fit the Benchmade 42 balisong well
https://www.balisong.cz/sbirka/eng/myknife9.php
we use 60% of the pouch's height (= 5.28 in.) for length, because this is a smaller-capacity pocket
pocket_data.//min_item_length: half of height of the pocket = 2.64 in.

//max_contains_volume: we model this pocket type's capacity after the small back strap, but limit its length to the typical front strap (60% of total height of the pouch = 5.28 in.)
pocket_data.//min_item_length: half of height of the pocket = 2.64 in.

//notes: while the pouch is open-top and is advertised as accepting 40-oz water bottles, we model it as though it only takes smaller bottles, as a way to differentiate it from larger counterparts
description: A nylon pouch for storing water bottles.  Takes in bottles up to 0.75L in capacity.

variants.description: A nylon pouch for storing water bottles.  The top can be constrained by a drawstring.  Takes in bottles up to 0.75L in capacity.  <variant_black>
A nylon pouch for storing water bottles.  The top can be constrained by a drawstring.  Takes in bottles up to 0.75L in capacity.  <variant_coyote>

//weight: the source for weight gives conflicting information about the item's weight, listing both 84 g and 0.19 lbs ≈ 86 g
we err on the side of the heavier weight simply because it has a corresponding stated weight in US customary units
//material: has a tiny plastic cord lock at the top that's not worth considering as a separate material
